(OOC: Trying this from 1st POV.. *_* I'm writing this exactly as I 
think it)

::Teltoli - 1st POV::

I think the reality is finally beginning to get to me.. I ran away 
from the battle, the battle that *I* caused, and left my fellow 
Maximals to die. What have I done? Some might argue that it was bound 
to happen anyway, that the Maximals will always battle the Alliance, 
but it was I who needed help and .. shut *up* Teltoli.

Forgive me, I always babble. Whether it's a side effect of the nerves 
of the battle, or not, I don't think I'll ever know.

I'm sure the Maximals are doing fine, anyway.

Probably.

Dammit Teltoli, you need to concentrate on finding Carnage, and 
building up your friendship again!

Don't you just hate those thoughts that pop into your head, right 
when you don't want them to? I think it's called Impulse Thinking, 
and it happens all the time to me. Right when you don't want a memory 
to be brought up, you remember it with such clarity you start to feel 
guilty all over again? Oh yeah...

No, don't me wrong, I've had the best life one could possible have. 
My parents are still alive (I think), I was an only child so I got 
all the attention. No tragic deaths, No life scarring happenings, 
nothing. You know - that kinda makes me feel guilty too. Carnage had 
tragic deaths, and she coped with it kinda well. And here I am, 
moping over a tiny little something. Wait, I'm not moping, I'm.. 
*shut* *up* Teltoli!

Sigh.

I hope Carnage *is* around here somewhere, otherwise I will totally 
be wasting my time. What if she's in the Jungle or something? Do 
Raptors even go in the Jungle? The first time I met her, it was in a 
swamp, and she was stalking me. Ech.. swamp. 

Besides, if she was in these .. grasslands, I would surely be able to 
see her..
